bibl.title: The Asyut Project: Eighth Season of Fieldwork (2010). Avec résumé en anglais.
bibl.note: Ancient necropolis of Asyut, Joint mission of Sohag University, Freie Universität Berlin and Johannes Gutenberg-Universität Mainz. See in part. pp. 194-198: the Tomb of the Dogs from the Late and Graeco-Roman Period is covered by several layers proving later usages as Coptic dwellings; the animal remains are not only of canids, but also of other species, such as cats.
bibl.seg: Kahl Jochem, Mahmoud El-Khadragy, Ursula Verhoeven, Mohamed Abdelrahiem, Hesham Faheed Ahmed, Chiori Kitagawa, Josephine Malur, Silvia Prell and Teodozja Rzeuska, The Asyut Project: Eighth Season of Fieldwork (2010). Avec résumé en anglais.
Studien zur Altägyptischen Kultur 40 (2011) pp. 181-209, 13 figg. et pll. 6-13.

Ancient necropolis of Asyut, Joint mission of Sohag University, Freie Universität Berlin and Johannes Gutenberg-Universität Mainz. See in part. pp. 194-198: the Tomb of the Dogs from the Late and Graeco-Roman Period is covered by several layers proving later usages as Coptic dwellings; the animal remains are not only of canids, but also of other species, such as cats.
Kahl El-Khadragy Verhoeven Abdelrahiem Ahmed Kitagawa Malur Prell Rzeuska
